items.preText: 3.30pm Thanks, Sreshth, and a good afternoon to all of you. Lots of changes for Bangladesh, one of them at the top of their batting order. It'll be Soumya Sarkar, who last played an ODI in October 2017, to open the batting with Liton Das. A bit of a breeze blows across the Sheikh Zayed Stadium as Junaid Khan marks his run-up for the first time in the tournament. He'll bowl left-arm over to Liton, with a wide-ish slip in place. 3.24pm Time for the national anthems. Two beautiful pieces of music. First, Bangladesh's Amar sonar Bangla resonates around the ground. And now, for Pakistan's Quaim-i-tarana. Flags waving, face-masks on, the mood has been set for an electric game of cricket. And here's Karthik Krishnaswamy to start off the contest. Lakshman Kumar: "I would prefer Bangladesh over Pakistan, to win this match..! Instead of another one-sided Ind-Pak match, we can see if Bangladesh can seek revenge of the Nidahas Trophy finale..! " Saad khan: "@Yoel, I still believe Safi was right when he said so, talent is there but only thing is they are feeling the pressure. Its only psychological, one good catch, one good run-out and Pakistan is back to the party. " Luks: "@inteser, agree.. Fifth bowler quota will be filled by Riyad, Soumya and Mominul with his sla orthodox spin " Syed Taha: "Mickey is right, Pakistani players lack confidence. Just look at the team on paper, undoubtedly they've got the best players in but they've struggled to perform in UAE which is their virtual home ground. A good game today and they could be lifting the trophy this Friday." Don't forget to tune into our Match Day show with Sanjay Manjrekar and Saqlain Mushtaq on the ESPNcricinfo homepages. Just hit refresh if you don't spot it! And speaking of Junaid Khan, he recently caught up with us. Enjoy this short conversation with him as we build up to the first ball. Pakistan: Fakhar Zaman, Imam Ul Haq, Babar Azam, Sarfraz Ahmed (c, wk), Shoaib Malik, Asif Ali, Shadab Khan, Mohammad Nawaz, Hasan Ali, Junaid Khan, Shaheen Shah Afridi Bangladesh: Liton Das, Soumya Sarkar, Mohammad Mithun, Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), Mominul Haque, Imrul Kayes, Mahmudullah, Mashrafe Mortaza (c), Mehidy Hasan, Rubel Hossain, Mustafizur Rahman Inteser: "Shakib not playing is a huge blow. Should have played Apu for the other spin option. Not a very wise decision to use Soumya's part timers to cover Shakib's 10 overs. That might just cost us the match. Mahmudullah will give you a good 5 overs, but he again, is not a specialist spinner. Only one specialist spinner (Miraz) on a spinning wicket is suicide." 3pm The two captains walk out and Bangladesh win the toss and choose to bat. Mashrafe: Looks like a good wicket. We lost many wickets in the middle during the last game, but Nos. 6 and 7 batted well last time, so hopefully we'll do well. Shanto is not playing. Soumya is coming back. Apu is not playing, and Rubel is back. And big loss that Shkaib is not playing. He's fractured his finger. Mominul is also in. Fans have been supporting us. Sarfraz: Conditions do change when the evening comes. We've spoken to the batsmen, and we want to play positive cricket. Bangladesh bats long, so we'll try to get them out fast and chase the target down. Junaid Khan's in for Mohammad Amir Yoel: "Almost one year ago, Sarfraz claimed Pakistan has the best bowling attack in the world. I wonder if he still feels that way." Jai Srivastava: "If Bangladesh wins this game by fluke, then they play India in the finals despite having a below average tournament, while Afghanistan who had a brilliant tournament are out. Don't you think that's unfair?" -- Life's unfair, isn't it? Afghanistan have been brilliant no doubt, and I'm sure we'll be seeing more from them in the coming years. Pitch and conditions: Unsurprisingly warm and sunny, but there's a bit of grass on this surface. Ramiz Raja believes bat first, get 250, and then unleash your spinners. Psychic Rahul: "At the start of the tournament, I picturized Pakistan unleashing their quicks and running through lineups - Amir, Juniad, Hasan Ali, Shaheen Shah and Shadab - looked the most threatening attack - but after the pastings by India - it now seems Bangladesh has a good chance of winning this" 2.50pm Fitness has been the No. 1 priority in the Pakistan camp, but their fielding has been woeful in the Asia Cup. Is it an after-effect of the departure of Steve Rixon, their fielding coach? Danyal Rasool investigates. Sanjay Manjrekar, meanwhile, believes Pakistan have the upper hand today. Agree? 2.45pm Despite having an average tournament so far, Bangladesh come into the contest with a win. Pakistan, on the other hand, will have to lift themselves up after the loss to India. Mohammad Isam's match preview has more. Waseem Sarwar: "Pakistan won't be going home even if they lose this match. They are supposed to play "Home" series against Australia next week in UAE. :) " 2.30pm Hello and welcome to the final super four match virtual semi-final of the Asia Cup between Pakistan and Bangladesh. Winner plays the final against India on friday, loser goes home. No pressure for either side then, eh? Both teams have been lukewarm through the tournament, so this is their final throw of the dice.
items.text: full, a tiny bit of shape in towards middle and leg, clipped away through backward square leg. Came off the inside half of the bat
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Liton Das, 2 runs

items.text: back of a length on middle and leg, clipped watchfully to midwicket
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Liton Das, no run

items.text: ooh, good ball. Back of a length again, pitching within the stumps and slanting away, and this one nips away off the seam to beat Liton's hesitant prod
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Liton Das, no run

items.preText: Liton's batting outside his crease here
items.text: back of a length, finishing on an off-stumpish line, defended into the covers
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Liton Das, no run

items.text: a touch shorter, slants into a fourth-stump line. Lets it come on and guides it to third man with an open face
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: length ball close to off stump, decent stride forward to block it back to the bowler
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText:
Here's Shaheen Afridi.

Ajeet Singh: "Soumya Sarkar needs 33 runs to reach his personal milestone of 1000 runs in ODIs. All the best Soumya."
items.text: fullish outside off, defended to mid-off
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Liton Das, no run

items.text: full again, slanting away from off stump, searching for swing and not really finding it. Nice stride forward to drive to mid-off
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Liton Das, no run

items.text: nice length, still quite full but not driveable, and Liton judges it well and leaves it alone. Carries through at chest height to Sarfraz
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Liton Das, no run

items.text: full on off stump, clipped to mid-on
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Liton Das, no run

items.text: very full, yorker length outside off. Liton is beaten as he tries to jam his bat down and squeeze it away through point
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length ball on middle and off, defended to midwicket and Shaheen starts with a maiden
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Liton Das, no run

items.preText: Syed Mohsin: "This may get some serious opposition but Hafeez balances the side. An allrounder in top 6 who can bowl more than 5 overs is a benefit. Not a big fan of his batting but his economical bowling is dearly missed. " -- I also dearly miss his sweetly timed drives.
items.text: fullish, angling down leg. Looks to flick, misses, and the ball ricochets off his pad towards square leg
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, 1 leg bye

items.text: back of a length, slanting away from off stump, steered down to third man
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot to play a checked drive to mid-off
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: nice length again, brings him half-forward. Slightly wider line, lets it come on and punches to cover point
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: out for a duck on comeback, and that's very well bowled. He's been bringing him forward with his lengths so far, and he digs this one in short, and outside off stump. Gets it up to shoulder height, and Soumya is in no position to control his pull. Ends up skying it and offering a simple catch to square leg. Mohammad Amir has been struggling for wickets, and his replacement strikes in his second over
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, OUT

dismissal.text: Soumya Sarkar c Fakhar Zaman b Junaid Khan 0 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

items.preText: Mominul Haque is in at No. 3. He has replaced the injured Shakib Al Hasan in Bangladesh's XI.
items.text: nice length, fairly full outside off, left alone. Hardly any carry this time, bounces a second time before it reaches the keeper
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mominul Haque, no run

items.text: back of a length close to off stump, Liton opens his bat face and picks up yet another single to third man
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, angling into off stump, worked away to deep square leg
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mominul Haque, 1 run

items.text: full on middle and leg, flicked to the left of fine leg
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: shot! That's gorgeous from Mominul, an effortless flick between midwicket and mid-on, but the ball was a gift, overpitched and angling into middle and leg
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mominul Haque, FOUR runs

items.text: and he follows up with a beaut and beats Mominul for pace! Back of a length, pitches outside off and nips back in off the track, skids off the wicket and Mominul is late bringing his bat down in defence. Didn't really matter, because it would have beaten his inside edge anyway. Cannons off the back pad and leaves his off stump spinning. Pakistan's left-arm quicks are on fire here
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mominul Haque, OUT

dismissal.text: Mominul Haque  b Shaheen Shah Afridi 5 (4b 1x4 0x6) SR: 125.00

items.preText: Mushfiqur Rahim is in at No. 4
items.text: and Shaheen greets him with a sharp bouncer that he has to duck hurriedly under
items.shortText: Shaheen Shah Afridi to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText:
Junaid goes round the wicket now, to Liton. No slip now, a deepish gully in place instead.

Walrus: "This ASIA CUP really brings to light just how much BD needs Tamim Iqbal at the top to stabilise things. And yet for so long we complained of his slow strike rate. I'd rather be 40 for 0 at 10 overs than 30/3. Also goes to show how difficult it will be for BD when the big 4 eventually retire. Don't see any young batsmen standing up for BD."
items.text: length ball angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Liton Das, no run
